website_summaries.verdict: Uses a soft nylon-covered foam material to deliver the protection for the pet while remaining comfortable.
pros: Surface of the collar is water resistant and easy to wipe clean
Available in multiple sizes and 2 colors to find just the right match for your pet
Includes an optional plastic shell when you want to give the collar a bit of extra stiffness
cons: Bulkier material than some other options
Lots of hook-and-loop straps that may end up getting in the way

customer_reviews.title: Size Chart NOT correct on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this can possibly happen, but it caused me to order a Large, when I really needed an Extra Large. After I received the product and it wouldn't fit, I went to the company's web site and saw a totally different size chart. I'm including that here, in case it is helpful to others. I do like the product, because it is soft, but not so floppy that it closes down over the dog's head when he sleeps.
customer_reviews.author: David Butler

customer_reviews.title: ... dog had ACL surgery thinking he would be more comfortable with a soft cone instead of the hard plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the XL size after my 95 lb dog had ACL surgery thinking he would be more comfortable with a soft cone instead of the hard plastic cone given to us. I was completely wrong. My dog freaked out wearing this because it is pitch black on all sides and he couldn't see through the sides or on top. I like the idea that this is soft and comfortable, however, maybe making it pitch black and limiting the dog's field of vision is not the best idea.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Never unfolds into a circle, stays triangular and flat
customer_reviews.text: I could never get it to unfold, I’d put it on my dog, Velcro it together, and it was like it was folded for too long...it just stayed smooshed and was very uncomfortable for my dog. It was like holding my hands on his head, he felt it smooshed on his face and couldn’t get comfortable at all. If it shipped flat instead of folded maybe it’d be different (that’s how the plastic ones ship) but it ships folded, velcroed and flat.
customer_reviews.author: C.R. Huntington

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend for dog that will be neutered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this collar based on the good feedback provided on Amazon. I thought that this collar will be better for our lab than the classical plastic one. At the end, we realized that it was a bad idea. Our dog was able to lick the suture by blocking the comfy cone against the wall. The incision has been infected and we had to spend more than $160 at the vet mainly due to medication to fix the infection. It is not a size issue, it is mainly because this cone is not enough rigid to prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: blinding
customer_reviews.text: This cone is entirely too tall once placed on the animal causing them to be blinded by the black sides. It's height ends up making the cones into an amplifier for sounds which also startle the dog. If the idea is to be more comfortable, turn the support pieces horizontal rather than vertical so flexibility is increased, shorten the height of the product by at least 3 inches to allow for more freedom while still preventing access to the wound site, and use clear materials to increase the animals peripheral vision. My dog spent more time slamming its head into everything and freaking out about movement/sounds than they did resting comfy while recovering from surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sotny

customer_reviews.title: Petrified lamlshade dog
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff and because it's not see through, our dog was beyond petrified wearing it. We even tried getting him used to it, but when he had it on, he just froze, head sinking lower and lower. He even froze mid-step for about 10 minutes. Also, not good for in he crate unless you have a small dog in a huuuuge crate. Our dog, when he moved in the crate, would get the collar stuck. We needed up getting him a donut. We would've returned this but we forgot.
customer_reviews.author: Hana

customer_reviews.title: Velcro Overkill --- not so comfy for small pups ---
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this comfy cone in small for my 7lb chihuahua based on the raving reviews. The cone has a stiff vinyl neckline which makes this collar considerably less than comfy, and there are several strips of oversized Velcro that attaches the cone firmly. Adding fear to discomfort, this Velcro makes a loud ripping noise when removing the strips, and scared my pup who screamed at the sound. To keep my pup from licking his back wound, I found that a soft scarf wrapped around the neck did a lovely job. Also, I ordered this item in an emergency with 1 day shipping, it arrived 4 days later.
customer_reviews.author: Pria

customer_reviews.title: So soft that pup chewed through it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a really poor product choice for a lab (average chewer). I thought the soft cone would be more comfortable, but instead my dog seemed to be even more unhappy than when she was in a cheap plastic cone. It looked like it was so heavy she was drooping her head all day. She was so traumatized when we first put it on that she wouldn't budge, not even when we offered her treats (extremely uncommon). Then she ended up chewing the cone before we had it even one full day. I thought it was worth the money because it was reusable. Not so much for my chewing pup. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Cone of Shame
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, true to size based on chart provided but not a lot of extra room if attached perfectly aligned. It has a small extra Velcro strap I found allows you to customize fit more rather than attaching it fully aligned on collar’s Velcro. I attached neck a little tighter than towards my dogs head. We got XS for Lhasa Alpso/Shih Tzu mix. The removable stiff pieces is a nice feature, took them out to make our dog more comfy. The Velcro is strong enough to keep it on if your pup in any relentless about trying to take it off. Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Real Feedback

customer_reviews.title: Great, soft, versatile sizes
customer_reviews.text: A cone is still a cone, but I think this is much better than hard plastic. We needed to keep our dog from licking his feet, and this is a lightweight and softer solution. It can also be inverted so that the cone covers a dog's shoulders and upper body to prevent licking stitches or something in that area. It is easy to take on and off, and has multiple size options and reinforced tabs to keep it closed. Our dog is terrified of the velcro noise, however, but we've discovered that we can actually slide it on and off of him pretty easily without having to open it, thereby avoiding the ripping velcro noise.
customer_reviews.author: Danica

customer_reviews.title: Buy It Before You Need It!
customer_reviews.text: Had to use this product for the first time today and my pup is basically using it as a pillow. She adores it. I’m pretty sure she’s going to be sad when I put it away and excited next time she (inevitably) needs it. I knew this would be better than the Cone of Shame, but I’m incredibly impressed by *how much* better it is. Recommend with zero hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: eyetrieditathome

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the plastic cones!
customer_reviews.text: My 27 lbs Beagle did NOT like the clear plastic cone I bought from the vet following a surgery: bumped into door jams and tipped the water bowl. I ordered this one in medium and it fit him perfectly. Loved that I could remove the stays so that he could sleep and move around comfortably. Super easy velcro closures very secure. And I really loved the fact that you can fold it over to facilitate eating/drinking. When he was fully recovered, I tossed it in the washer: came out perfect. I'm saving it for sure although I hope not to need it again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find this product. I prefer the donut hole types but in this case, my dog was getting around that so I needed to try something else. This worked great. Trust the sizing instructions. I gave it a four stars for cleaning only because hair gets stuck in the velcro. An improvement IMO would be strips you could put on the velcro you aren't using which I could buy myself, but if provided would greatly improve the customer quality of this product. Otherwise really well made, perfect for the need. I am satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs needing the dreaded "Cone"
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these before with my own dog with a licking problem that led us to find out he had a 'grass allergy'. My dear Buddy who was an amazing dog wore one for months. We'd wash each one after 2-3 days of wear cause they get dirty from eating and drooling. Easy cleaning when washed on a normal cycle. Hang to dry. I rated this with a 5 because the Range of Motion was a 3 because it did the job well, same 3*** for Stretch it doesn't stretch, it's just soft with a 'cordura' type of fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: As stated in its name, this dog cone IS comfy!
customer_reviews.text: We got this cone for our dog, Henry, who had a corneal procedure and was very uncomfortable. The vet told us to prevent Henry from rubbing his eye as this would inhibit healing. Unfortunately the cone we got from the vet was clunky, uncomfortable and heavy. So we got the Comfy Cone from Amazon which arrived in 2 days and has been fantastic. It fits perfectly, is light weight but sturdy, and prevents Henry from rubbing his eye. He can still eat and drink from a bowl while wearing it and now we don’t have to spend every minute checking to make sure Henry isn’t rubbing his eye.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Littman

customer_reviews.title: My dog cried the whole time
customer_reviews.text: My dog had to get surgery to remove a tumor on his neck. I bought this thinking that it would be softer than the plastic version. I mean, it was. But he cried the ENTIRE time this was on him. When I finally got another cone (the blue donut type) he didn't cry at all. So it wasn't haven't something on his neck, it was this thing. He didn't tell me why he hated it, so I can only guess. My thoughts are that he couldn't see anywhere, the black blocked his view in every direction. It was also very heavy and dragged the ground, despite sizing it based on their instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Fossett

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t really keep him away from stitches
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Aussidoodle post neutering. I bought it because it seemed so much better than to traditional plastic cone. However, I have had to stop him from gnawing at his stitches a few times. It seems to be too short. If you’re protecting something that isn’t as easy to get to, this may work. It isn’t really doing I what I had hoped it would. I will probably just try something else. Overall, I’m disappointed this didn’t work as I’d hoped. He is able to eat and drink with it on, and he looks fairly comfortable sleeping in it.
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear

customer_reviews.title: It worked!
customer_reviews.text: We tried a plastic cone prior to buying this Comfy Cone and oh my gosh. It was a nightmare. Our dog had surgery to remove a growth on his front paw and we've tried cones before with Logan and he just will NOT wear one. He flings himself to and fro while tearing at them with his FRONT paws! No amount of treats or comfort or time stopped this. This thing was my last attempt, post infection and a second surgery (the vet removed his stitches too soon) and it saved us! My sanity and Logan's foot! Was he happy? No. Did he tolerate it? YES. So much better!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Dog Like Collar
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why, but my dog actually loves his comfy collar. My sister is a veterinarian and doesn't have an answer either. Maybe it feels like a pillow to him laying down. Maybe because it blocks some peripheral vision he doesn't see some things that trigger his anxiety. Maybe he's just weird. All I know is the last week when I've had to take the collar off for some reason, when I pick it up to put it back on he comes running across the room like its a toy or treat.
customer_reviews.author: Lori G

customer_reviews.title: You need it...
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE THING TO HAVE FOR PET OWNERS!!! My pit hurt her eye and we had to keep her from pawing at it and rubbing the medication off on the carpet. I hated doing it to her but it just wouldn't heal. She still ran into everything in the house, including me being very pregnant..... but the foam bends so it didn't scratch up the walls like the ones from the vet, didn't dig into her skin, and didn't hurt my legs. Soooooooo worth the money! You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Mastiff
customer_reviews.text: We have an American Mastiff; 180 pounds. When scheduled for minor surgery, I knew she (nor us) could not tolerate the typical hard plastic cone. So we ordered this and could not be happier. Yes, it is the "cone of shame"; awkward and certainly in her way. But it works and it is so much better. She is now in day 8 of 13 days and coping with it beautifully. Doesn't mean that she won't be happy to get rid of it on Monday ..... but it has done its job, kept her safe and been as comfortable as possible. I recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Baker Raj

customer_reviews.title: Claustrophobic experience for puppy
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is more comfortable than the traditional plastic e-collar a vet might provide. However, my puppy freaked out (whimpering, whining, staring at the floor) because the cone is black inside and I think she was feeling claustrophobic and sorry for herself. Her peripheral vision was surrounded with... darkness even though it was daytime. She was incredibly unhappy- surrounded by darkness, could not eat or play with her toys with this cone on. We switched the puppy over to an inflatable donut shaped e-collar, and her demeanor changed to a happy one immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jane A

customer_reviews.title: TOO SHALLOW
customer_reviews.text: The cone is too shallow. I took the correct measurements based on the chart and her nose was even with the edge of the cone. She ended up EATING tip of her tail off from the injury we originally bought the cone for. Now I'm going back to the Vet *again* The idea of this product is good. The Velcro makes things easy to put on/take off and the removable plastic strips are convenient. But the depth is far to shallow.
customer_reviews.author: EVdeluxe

customer_reviews.title: Soft but stays put!
customer_reviews.text: Needed an e-collar for a dog who itches with seasonal allergies. The sizing information was very helpful--we measured the neck circumference and neck-to-nose as directed, and the indicated size really does fit correctly. The three different velcro strips let us fit it securely but not too tightly around her neck, and the elastic bands to slide her collar through add security to help prevent her from sliding it over her head. It seems sturdy and well-made, is much softer and more comfortable than the plastic ones we have gotten at the vet, and is effective at preventing the dog from scratching her face ... despite her best efforts! Would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Lucia

customer_reviews.title: LONG enough, finally
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought an XL one when our Dane had surgery and worked well. But, that size didn't work for our Presa Canario after a tail amputation, it just wasn't long enough to prevent her from reaching it... I searched all over and couldn't find a longer cone by anyone, then noticed this brand had an XXL... so far this is the first day I've been able to leave her home alone b/c this size cone is long enough... I mean, it's absolutely huge looking on her (75 lb dog), but the length is perfect for the need. I wish it allowed some light to pass through like the plastic ones, but it's doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: IT'S SARAH DAMMIT

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.  Comfort, safety, ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Medium extra-long size for our Belgian Malinois after her spay procedure. She is so flexible, her neck and snout so long, that the inflatable models were pointless (borrowed from someone to try out). This style of e-collar is fantastic, and so much easier on our calves, shins, furniture, her neck, and especially her comfort when we rolled the top back for greater sight/sound for her. So easy to put on and take off for certain supervised activities like walks or eating. There is no question in my mind that this reduced the stress of an already stressful procedure. I would absolutely purchase again if needed in a different size. The cost is small, just get one!
customer_reviews.author: SEvans

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate sizing chart
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the X-small collar for my dog based on the sizing chart. It's way too small for him. He has a hot spot on his front paw and has absolutely no issue getting to it with the cone on. Amazon is requiring me to pay for the shipping to return it so there's no point. Now I'm stuck with this collar that's useless to me and my dog still has this hot spot that won't heal because he won't quit licking it. I'm beyond frustrated with this purchase. 0 stars for Amazon's new return process and 1 star for the collar because it seems like it might actually be nice provided you get the sizing correct.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY HUDGINS

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This collar is wonderful! Our puppy was so uncomfortable in his plastic e-collar. He kept scrapping his incision on his tummy and his neutering area! After 6 days of dealing with his misery and worrying about him injuring himself; I ordered this soft collar. It is truly a wonder. He is comfortable and unable to reach his surgical sites. He had an umbilical hernia and was neutered. He was beyond miserable! The collar fit perfectly and he is able to lie down and rest. FINALLY! I recommend this product for anyone who has a dog having surgery. He is so much happier and will heal easier without the misery of that plastic tortuous e-collar!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Comfy cone
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sent us the wrong size, but since we didn’t have time to wait for another we ended up just using it. It fit on the lowest velcro strip. The cone seems comfortable enough. He will sleep in it through out the night without being annoyed by it. He can easily drink with it too. It’s easy for us to put on the dog, but just as easy for our dog to take off. He has learned to drag the cone against the couch cushions to rip the velcro apart. It works well, until your dog outsmarts the cone.
customer_reviews.author: BJF8426

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks
customer_reviews.text: I guess it is slightly more comfortable than the plastic cone my vet gave us, but I really hate how the "cone" ends up in more of a pointed shape because of the folds in the design. I keep trying to bend it back into more of a circular shape, but it doesn't stay that way. Due to this, I think she has even less open space next to her head. I'm going to buy something else to help her recover. Would not recommend - order something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mfm05

customer_reviews.title: A couple issues
customer_reviews.text: The only way I could keep this on my dog was to use both the collar and a harness with another strap between so he can't use both front paws to push it off over his head. The second problem is one that I just wasn't thinking about when I purchased it. The material, though it feels nice, is completely solid , effectively becoming a blinder where the dog can only see straight in front of him. He can't see steps or anything on the ground where he is walking so he trips and I am afraid this will cause him to become injured, which defeats the purpose of buying it.
customer_reviews.author: SoulsSong

customer_reviews.title: Definitely better then the plastic cone
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better option then the large plastic cone you get from the vet's office. It sits very comfortably when on my dog's collar and doesn't seem to dig into his neck. Also it's a little bit shorter then the plastic cones which is great for the dog's visibility while still keeping the dog from getting at his incision. The durability seems to be pretty good as well. My dog hits the cone on every surface, especially when walking through doorways, AND the cone stays in place and is not damaged. Great purchase. Wearing a cone is going to suck either way but at least this makes it a little more bearable.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Comfier cone of shame.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my doggie is licking raw her dangling fatty tumor (aka her chesticle). Likes: it’s Velcro so it’s easy to close. The $15 plastic cone the vet charged me for went immediately into the trash. It was a pain to try to close with a squirmy dog. Dislikes: it’s a cone. My doggie loathes it and shakes like mad. She finally settled down on the couch. I bought the XL for my 70lb lab mix. She’s upset with me.
customer_reviews.author: PhunkyPhotog

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the plastic cone!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I didn't order this ahead of time and my dog came home in the plastic cone from the vet following eye surgery. The comfy cone is a better fit and he's seems comfortable in it. Unlike the plastic cone, he can maneuver the stairs in it. It also doesn't hurt when he bangs into me with it. The Velcro is really strong, I don't think he could get the cone off if he tried. He's wearing the extra large. He is a large lab with a 19 inch neck.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alternative to plastic cones!
customer_reviews.text: We got this cone for my 1 year old husky who got his dew claw removed. Our plastic cone was getting dirty and it wasn’t flexible so he couldn’t get through doors, his crate, or the dog door. Size L cone is the perfect size for him and our 4 year old husky!
customer_reviews.author: Garym95

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for neuter procedure healing
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 1 yo aussiedoodle who just got neutered. It fit OK the first day until he figured out that he can just push down the cone to access the sight. The outside of the cone is rough therefore any time your animal wants to try to access the incision sight that sight comes in contact with a non-smooth texture which is on the outside of the cone. This created a huge problem for our pet who is now on antibiotics to heal the infected skin where it was rubbed. I do not recommend this product for a animal that is needing to heal from a neuter.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my dog, but it depends the type of dog you have.
customer_reviews.text: I like this soft cone, however my dog has a different opinion. It’s easy to use and clean. I like that you can make it ridged by adding in the plastic bones. Be aware that depending how long your dog is and what you’re trying to keep them from licking will determine what type of cone to use. This worked great for my short faced, 19 lbs mixed breed terrier who has allergies. If the area she was trying to chew was lower on her back she’d be able to reach it with this type of cone. She’s able to run around and play, eat and drink and rest comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Puppy-Love

customer_reviews.title: So WORTH the price... saved my dog's eye!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase I ever made on Amazon. My German Shepherd had a scratched cornea that would not heal because she kept scratching and re-injuring it. The plastic collar that the vet gave us made her miserable. We put this one on her and she was perfectly comfortable. It had to stay on for quite a while, but she did not fuss the way she did when the plastic one was on. Once her eye healed, having the cone on had trained her not to scratch so roughly - so we have had no more problems with her injuring her eye again. EXCELLENT product Comfy Cone!!
customer_reviews.author: jan c.

customer_reviews.title: Very Compassionate Solution to Wound Licking Issues... Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I didn't think the stays were very important (for us) and removed them to assist with mobility around the house. I definitely ordered to large... I got and Extra-large for a75# Samoyed with a longish snout and should have gotten a Medium or Large, but the soft material allowed me to fold the extra material back. The dog didn't mind it at all after the first 30-minutes of adjustment and it saved further damage to the spot she was licking raw. 3-weeks later it was all healed, the cone came off and the dog never licked it again.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Winfree

customer_reviews.title: Saved my cat's face
customer_reviews.text: This cone has been on my cat for almost a month. She has asthma which can cause infection issues. So in order to keep her from tearing herself up my vet suggested we try this type of cone. It's very light and she has learned to live with it while still managing to be able to do everything. I do have to take it off for food and water because it is much too tall for her head. But in total I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Took out the stiff inserts
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Took out the stiff inserts, and honestly my dog doesn't seem to mind it that much. She scraped her knee recently and would keep licking it not allowing it to ever heal and it's extremely hard to wrap or properly bandage my dogs knee. So ya this has really helped her manage to stay away from it and it actually allowed it to finally heal! She can lay down with this thing on and be comfortable, it's definitely a LOT better than the plastic cones! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Tunnel vision
customer_reviews.text: I should have returned this item. My dog did not like this because she could not see as she would with bulky clear collar. This collar needs some clear slats so your pet can see from the sides and not have tunnel vision. My dog was very uncomfortable, did better with bulky clear one. Went back to old collar the Vet had. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ReinaGirl

customer_reviews.title: BUY FOR YOUR DOG ASAP
customer_reviews.text: MUST BUY! My puppy was spayed and had to be in a cone for 10-14 days. We came home with the traditional hard, plastic cone and she was miserable. I put this cone on her the next day and she wore it like a champ for 10 days. I could tell that she felt so much more comfortable and we could easily take it on and off for little breaks. I read reviews about how the Velcro made some dogs nervous and even my puppy (who is deaf) wasn’t the biggest fan of it, but it wasn’t a deal breaker. Oh and it’s also very easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Eyed Jeepher

customer_reviews.title: Best Cone on the Market
customer_reviews.text: My dog just had a hip replacement. She only had to wear this for a few days because I also ordered her post-surgery pajamas, but this was SO much better than the plastic cone we had from a previous injury! She could move around, eat, drink and sleep comfortably but not get to her stitches. It was also very easy to open, close, and adjust. I HIGHLY recommend this comfy cone if your dog is having any surgery. PS. We got the medium extra long. It’s a good thing, because it just barely came to the top of her nose.
customer_reviews.author: LeArtiste

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the plastic e-collar!
customer_reviews.text: My dog got fixed and had to wear the e-collar for a week. He was so miserable in the plastic one. then he would ram it into the back of my legs and we were miserable together. So I bought this one and we were both much happier with the results! Being able to just velcro it on and off was such a godsend because he didn't have to wear it all the time (it would take me so long to get the plastic one on and off). He didn't seem to mind having the extra cushioning while he slept either. Overall, I would highly recommend for any dog!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the standard plastic cone of shame.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my pup that had knee surgery. Was just the right size for my 55lb Pit/Catahoula mix - it couldn't have been any smaller, but it worked well. Even my vet thought it was great. We did attach it to a collar to keep it secure. She still hated having to wear it, but it was so much better than the rigid plastic cones - I'd highly recommend the design/product to any dog owner in need of such.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Fendt

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: My Yorkie has had knee surgery, so I purchased this because I thought she'd be more comfortable with some padding. Unfortunately, it was way too bulky for such a tiny dog (7 pounds). Even though it was the right size, she had a hard time moving her head and her hair was squished against her face. No matter how I placed the hook and loop material, it looked more like a very tall turtle neck than an e-collar. It might be OK for a larger dog, but not a tiny pup. Since she looked happier in the plastic collar the vet gave her, I decided to return this one.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: A much more comfortable alternative for my corgi
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that I purchased this for my corgi. The standard plastic cone was making my poor girl absolutely miserable so I gave this a shot and it's really, really made a difference. It's durable, but soft and flexible (once I took out the hard plastic support rods) enough to be comfortable for her. And the opacity, which I thought would be problematic, hasn't hindered her at all. Plus the velcro makes this a breeze to put on and take off. This cone does have loops that you can weave your dog's collar through, but I haven't found that necessary. Bonus round is that the silver rim is reflective. Overall this was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: KyraTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Good cone alternative
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better option over the typical plastic cone. It is warm and difficult for the dog to see around it because it is solid. The plastic forms have popped thru the outside perimeter and we've had to tape them in place. This cone has really taken a beating. It does seem comfortable for the dog to sleep with it on. The collar must go thru the loops to keep it in place, so we must take the collar off of we take the cone off. I would suggest this product because it does keep him from licking his sore, but there are a few issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J. Kreiner

customer_reviews.title: This is the cone to get.
customer_reviews.text: After getting our second dog neutered, this cone was a life saver! Our first dog had to use a hard cone and hated every second of it - he couldn't sleep right, he couldn't eat easily, and getting the cone on and off for bathroom breaks was a hassle. The Comfy cone allowed our second dog to easily rest as the material is nylon/foam, and it's held together by (tough!) velcro. It was relatively easy to just slip it on and off, and our pup could sleep well with it on too. Cleaning is easily done either by spot cleaning or a light wash.
customer_reviews.author: imyourpal

customer_reviews.title: These Work Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I needed two cones for (hopefully) a one time deal. I was able to get two Comfy Cones at a discounted price due to cosmetic defect (never did find the defect). They worked great and fit as expected. I have outside dogs who live in a kennel. They are very active and not used to wearing anything but a collar. They did not fight the Comfy Cone. They ate and drank water. I kept them on for 24 hours. I like the flexibility of being able to remove the stays, which kept in, but I like this options. This is a quality product and I'm glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Great product, poor exchange options
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big fan of Comfy Cone but wish the seller would allow more options for exchanging for a different size. Unless I pay an extra $6 or drive a half hour one way to Amazon drop off, I’m stuck with what I have. This is probably the case for everyone, so bear it in mind before buying. Product itself continues to impress. I’ve used these for my little pups and just bought another for my new lab mix after her spay surgery. She’s 55 lbs and would have done better with a large, but we’ve made the x-large work since these are so adjustable. Just a little bit heavier on her than the large would be.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: must have for post surgery cone
customer_reviews.text: Night two after using this for my pup and having surgery on her hind leg and it’s been great. After making the bad decision of trying the one from my vets office I ordered this and definitely seen an improvement in my pups mood and and sleeping. She can easily rest on this cone as a pillow. I had to fight to put the cone from the vets office on her and it’s ridiculously easy for only me to add and remove the comfy cone. Do yourself a favor and go with this over the vets office cone. One tip as noted in other reviews... order one size larger than what you think you need.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Really good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this product! I recently discovered my dog is allergic to just about everything, and I don't want to put her on dangerous pharmaceuticals to ease the symptoms as the immune therapy hopefully does its work. The cone allows my German Shepherd plenty of freedom and she sleeps wonderfully when it is on. I wish I didn't have to restrict her like this, but the cone really offers me some peace of mind so I can get enough rest and not get too stressed as I take care of my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Nom

customer_reviews.title: Size Medium is Perfect for my 31 lb Shiba Inu
customer_reviews.text: Size Medium (regular, not long) is perfect for my shiba inu dog who is 31 lbs. I also bought a Large but it was way too big, gave that one away to a chow-chow dog friend. This is easy to take on and off with the velcro, and can be easily adjusted. My dog has allergies that cause skin problems so he has to wear a cone at least once a year. I've tried multiple kinds, and this one is by far the best in terms of comfort and durability. I've bought three, but that's only because my dog is naughty and chews on it when he's protesting the indignity. This is comfortable enough that he can sleep with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my pitbull after she got a cut on her tail because she kept chewing on her tail where the scab was and I was worried about it getting infected. She has NEVER been okay with wearing a cone. She gets depressed, upset and pouty. She has tried to rip off every cone weve used before. She LOVES this cone. I dont understand it lol I took it off to adjust it and she put her face into it and stared at me until I put it back on. She acts like it's her comfort blanket lol Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cone for Alaskan Malamute!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cone for my Malamute post double ACL surgery to keep him from licking, worked like a charm. My pup was able to drink water better in this type of cone versus the traditional type. I would suggest going down in size due to the cone running a bit large(I performed an exchange upon receiving the first cone for this reason). Additionally for dogs with anxiety flip the cone to have the color on the inside, assisted with calming my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha J

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable than plastic collars, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This collar worked very well. Across several weeks of use and taking if off a couple times each day for feeding and such, the velcro continues to work well. It's soft and flexible enough to be decent for the dog, the surface doesn't pick up weeds or dirt from the outside, and it's very quick and easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: B. Welch

customer_reviews.title: My Dog was able to get it off
customer_reviews.text: There's no question this type of e-collar will be more comfortable for your pet. And it'll be more comfortable for humans too while your pet is wearing it because it sure beats getting bumped by a hard plastic traditional e-collar. That said, my dog was able to get this off with very little effort and I'm confident it was the proper size. I gave it an honest shot and it just didn't work out for us. The traditional "cone of shame" provided by the vet is obnoxious, hard plastic but it served its purpose and stayed on. The peace of mind is that my dog is not getting at this wound trumps short-term discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be a very nice collar. I ordered a medium for my 11 ...
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be a very nice collar. I ordered a medium for my 11 lb. dog because I thought the small would be TOO small. I was wrong. The small may have worked better. Hopefully I'll never have to know. I'm not sure what breed my dog is (exactly) as he was a rescue but for anyone trying to figure out sizing I'll do my best to describe him so that you'll know weather to by a small or medium. My dog has a long neck similar to a chihuahua with a wide head kind of like a boston terrier. Like I said, the medium was too big.
customer_reviews.author: sdc

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Better than plastic cones and easy to put on and remove.
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a Great Dane to keep him from licking his paws and causing bacterial infections. Much better than the cones from the vet! However, it isn't quite long enough to keep him from reaching his paws, education use why I gave 4 stars, but it works well enough, and because it's soft it is easier from him and us. Cones on a Dane = damaged furniture and wall scratches and preventing that alone is worth the price! Easy to put on and take off.. Velcro holds strong!
customer_reviews.author: SierraPrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this collar to make it more comfortable for my dog to sleep while recovering from his surgery. Seems to have helped because he gets comfortable much quicker. I also noticed that his attitude changed immediately after switching this one for the plastic one provided by the vet. He is more upbeat and happy since the switch.
customer_reviews.author: H. Moya

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Cone
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a well designed collar and our dog (about 35 pounds) seems to actually enjoy wearing it. It is very comfortable for him to lay his head on and he has not yet been able to remove it (and really doesn't try). Also, it is a bit longer than regular cones and very effective. Also, very adjustable and the velcro is both very strong and flexible. If you need a cone for your hound and have had little success in the past, this is definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Don from Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a deep nail bed injury that required removal of two toes and also meant he needed to wear a hard plastic cone. Don't ask me how many times I was whacked by that cone, but it was a lot. I found the soft cone on Amazon, and put it in my dog. It was a much better solution for the two of us. He and I are much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Penny G

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Our big rottie girl needed to wear a cone to keep from licking stitches out. She originally had the hard plastic cone, which is cumbersome... if you've ever dealt with them you know, so we bought this one for her. It is great and keeps her away from all things on her body she can lick. It wipes off easily if it gets dirty and it collapses a little when she runs into things so it's easier to maneuver in. An added extra, it being black, seems to calm her down so she slept and rested more during recovery. A win win!
customer_reviews.author: thebigbaby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: This is so nice. My baby got a skin infection when the Virus began and I couldn't get him to vet till recently. This cone kept him as comfortable as he could be sleeping in it was allot nicer then that plastic one we had first. He's better now but this cone kept him from clawing himself bloody. And licking his paws.
customer_reviews.author: Hope2nou

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy for my 90.5 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: 1. I had a hard time adjusting this to fit around her neck 2. It is way too heavy, my poor girl tilted sideways and she's a big dog 3. I am sure it would be durable if I kept it but the whole point of buying such a thing was to keep my dog comfortable while preventing her from injuring herself further, she would run into walls trying to walk with that thing on. When I finally adjusted it to stay on. I kept it on her 20 seconds at most and took it off to return it. Too heavy, too big, too restrictive.
customer_reviews.author: Reine Soleil

customer_reviews.title: too much range of motion
customer_reviews.text: Comfort, range of motion and easy to clean are all perfect and an accurate description. My husky did not seem to irritated by it as her range of motion with the cone on didn’t limit her from getting to her hind leg and chew open her stitches from a biopsy (which was a malignant tumor). Due to the area having further trauma, the vets removed her right hind leg and I now have a tripawed. I don’t suggest this product as your animal will still be able to get to the area your trying to keep them from.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Michelle

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: We have a cocker spaniel and so bought a medium. Fits perfect! He scratched his eyeball with his nails and the eye got infected. Vet gave him one of those plastic collars and he hated it! Couldn't go upstairs comfortably and was just miserable, even after a couple of days. We bought this product and he was immediately happier! He can go up stairs and eat and drink water with no problem. Also sleeps easier and more comfortable. I think I will buy a bigger one for our other dog just in case he ever needs it. I like the tan/black because our doggie is buff colored with black eyes. Looks cute!
customer_reviews.author: E and K Tolson

customer_reviews.title: Much better than traditional collars and my vet really liked it too!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cone for pets after surgery! It is softer & less rigid than the E collars you get from the vet, yet works perfectly! I measured per instructions and the size large fit my Aussie perfect! I showed it to my vet and she really liked it and said she will recommend it to other pet parents. It was much easier for Sadie to sleep at night with the more cushion this provided. It is also very sturdy and easily adjustable. I highly recommend this product and will never use anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R.

customer_reviews.title: More comfy than the plastic cone
customer_reviews.text: Our dog seemed much more comfortable than in the plastic cone. She would actually lie down all the way on her side with this cone. It is also much easier on our door frames and walls. When the cone runs into the frames or walls it does not scratch or chip the paint. Also much better on walks when she would go to sniff rocks or trees it was not jarring to her if the cone hit them first. Would definitely recommend this cone! Be sure to check the chart for sizing.
customer_reviews.author: icarT

customer_reviews.title: Designed as a softer cone
customer_reviews.text: This was designed as a softer cone...and it is. My dog is 19 lbs and found a way out of it over and over. I think it said more about the shape of his head than the cone. To keep it on, I put his harness on, put a ribbon thru the elastic areas of the cone meant for the collar, and tied the ribbon to his harness. It served its purpose and I will pass it on to other family dogs who need one. When removing the collar, the Velcro is so noisy...scared the dog several times.
customer_reviews.author: Irishrn

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the plastic cone!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1. I love this. Sooo much better than the plastic cone from the vet. 2. I’ve used it multiple times on both my dogs, still works! 3. I bought the XL for my 90lb German Shepherd 4. It has loops that you can put a thin scarf or some gauze through to keep secure 5. It will allow them to lay their head down easier than the regular cone. Cons: 1. The Velcro gets hairy, but it still works good 2. I wish it was clear, but that’s what you must compromise for their comfort. Hope this is helpful!
customer_reviews.author: AmyF

customer_reviews.title: Much More Firm than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I have this and another flexible cone for my foster dog. We use this one when we are not home because it is very sturdy even without the inserts. The dog does not like it nearly as much as our ZenCone (which is also not perfect but works much better for when we are home and can keep an eye on our dog). The biggest problem with this one is that it is too rigid. Our dog struggles to get comfortable with it on. However, it vastly better than a plastic e-collar cone.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Seams haven't held up well
customer_reviews.text: Love how comfortable this was for my growing German Shepherd puppy who was having facial skin sensitivity issues. However, the seams that hold in the rigid stays came undone and I found them in the backyard. Because when the seams came undone, the rigid stays fell out. I didn't know they had come out until I got to wondering why it wasn't as rigid as when I first started using. I will eventually repair the seams, but I haven't had to use the cone in quite a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Easier on your pet and you
customer_reviews.text: My 85lb Rottweiler was not having it with the plastic cone. Couldn't sleep. It was difficulty for him to lay down. He wore me out. With that said, I don't usually review products unless they absolutely delivered plus more. And this product did. The velcros are strong and my dog can't just brush it off. The softness of it allowed my dog to lay down and sleep and he's just acting way better now. If you're looking for a way to make your dog comfortable and your life easier, this is the product for you. It's easy to take on and off for when he needs to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: D
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy and stiff cone that my puppy not only refused to wear but also got catatonic upon putting on. I have never seen her act this way before. We got the long one after measuring her as directed and it was way too long! She could not see a thing around her and she was terrified... We ended up returning this and getting her a shirt to prevent her from chewing the spay site. I would not recommend this item to anyone, especially for how expensive it is.
customer_reviews.author: Nil

customer_reviews.title: Awesome alternative to standard cone
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our pitbull pup after he had stomach surgery to remove a squeaker he swallowed before we could get it from him. He was 16 weeks old and had to wear it for 2 weeks while we were at work during the day. He never got it off and he definitely preferred it to the cone provided by the vet
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not really "soft"
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for our sick (kind of small) adult cat, this is not really soft, too stiff for her weak-self. Did not use, did not return. The removable stays and velcro look like it would be good for a more "tough" animal, maybe a collar for a healthier animal just after surgery. It's difficult to evaluate something like this ahead of time without being able to actually see and feel it. Would try to see in person first, next time.
customer_reviews.author: Desert D.

customer_reviews.title: Even after removing the plastic strips it definitely doesn't fold at all when she puts her head down like the promotional pictur
customer_reviews.text: The medium was just barely big enough for my 27 pound Mini-Aussie. Any smaller and it wouldn't have extended passed her snout. It's more stiff than I thought it would be. Even after removing the plastic strips it definitely doesn't fold at all when she puts her head down like the promotional pictures indicate it would. Still looks more comfortable than a plastic cone even thought it's just as stiff and unmoving, but this design means she can't seen anything through it either. It's held up well during 3 weeks of almost continuous use. No signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: YepYepYep

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff and unmanageable
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a sore on his elbow. Bought rapping and cone to try to heal it. Even with a muzzle on, he bit my husband twice as we tried in vain getting this cone on properly. I tried a variety of modifications to the cone which did not work, rendering it nonreturnable. We tried folding it over as shown in the video and that didn't work. He slipped it off his head even though I tightened his collar to an almost chocking position. He won, we were exhausted with the struggle and it went into the garbage the same night. The description is "soft pet recovery cone", this is a lie.
customer_reviews.author: Sammiemae

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us.
customer_reviews.text: My golden retriever had to have surgery on her back knee. A cone was required for a week to prevent her ripping out the staples. This soft cone allowed her to sleep more comfortably. However, she never really attempted to mess with her staples so I do not truly know if it would prevent a determined dog from reaching the back leg area. I was very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the horrible plastic cones from the vet! That cone was heavy and too long. My poor girl barely moved at all and bumped into everything when she did. With this cone she could navigate much better. The stays kept it from collapsing and protected her face. The noise didn't echo in this cone either. Super important for my blind girl... It was much more comfortable around her neck also. My only regret was that I didn't get it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Marnonicknamelo

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for our dog
customer_reviews.text: We have a rough coat collie with a long nose. I measured her neck to snout as instructed and ordered the XL accordingly. It was a lot bigger than expected but we tried it on her for a couple of days. It is only slightly more flexible than a plastic cone. The problem is that it obstructs peripheral vision, it is black and retains heat and the material does not breathe. On the second night my dog was pacing around the house whining. I took this off and put the plastic cone back on and she went right to sleep. That’s when I knew I had to return this. It’s a good concept but didn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: If your pet is in a cone you need this.
customer_reviews.text: OMG this is the best thing ever if your dog is injured or an excessive licker (like mine) so much easier on the legs and knees when she rams into me! UPDATE!! After almost one WHOLE year I have had to purchase a second. This Cone is a godsend! My dog has excessively itchy skin and also evidently OCD. This means she cannot be stopped licking. I have tried EVERYTHING. Short of keeping her heavily medicated this is the only thing that lets her have fur! We take it off her when we are home and can supervise her. Seriously your furniture and knees will thank you. WORTH EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.author: JustLaurie

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice alternative to the plastic cone you usually get at the vet visits, but our corgi got so used to the plastic one it was hard to transition to using this one. Don't get me wrong its comfortable, like he can at least lay in his crate without having to bump into everything, but because it's quite fitted to him he gets anxious not being able to see. It blocks his point of view. (We went with the recommended size on the chart and got a medium) So for now we'll use this when he goes to bed in his crate and the transparent plastic cone for morning use.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try this cone after my brute of a dog destroyed 4 $25 plastic cones just by running into things 🤦🏼‍♀️ I LOVE it. He’s had it for a couple days now and I see no damage. He’s a lot less sad in this cone and doesn’t run away when I go to put it on after he eats. He hasn’t managed to get it off yet but if he does I’ve found it’s reflective so that’ll make finding it in the backyard easier. My dog is a 65lb Pitbull and the XL is perfect. It’s on the smallest setting though so it could fit a dog with a much bigger neck.
customer_reviews.author: AlyssaEcho

customer_reviews.title: Good doggie cone
customer_reviews.text: Our doggie had a bad accident that rendered him paralyzed in his back legs. He developed bad sores and rashes on his back two legs. He had to have the cone on for almost 3 months. It was easy to clean and our doggie seemed to tolerate it very well. We liked the ability to close it with the velcro tabs to make it the right size around his neck. It was pretty hard for him to eat with it on, so we took it off of him for feeding time. Otherwise, his food would end up inside the cone. We would order it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Truly comfy!
customer_reviews.text: When my Aussie needed the cone of shame he came home with the rigid plastic torture collar from the vet. I thought it was over for all of us... The wood floors, his doxie brother, the walls, backs of legs etc.. The sound of the plastic terrified him and the darn thing was so bulky and awkward it was heartbreaking as you can see... This comfy cone saved us all from further terror and damage and allowed our pup to heal with the least amount of disruption. It was the best investment I could ever make in the care for my very skittish pup!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimmmbo

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but needs some modification
customer_reviews.text: Comfy for Junior and I like that one edge can be folded back for meal time. They have no problem sleeping with cone on. Remember that it has to be longer than dog's nose and tight enough on the neck that they can't learn to push it back toward their shoulders to get to licking spot. My guys are able to figure all this out so I use a donut (or a swim noodle cut into one inch rings and threaded on the collar) behind the cone to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: DalPal

customer_reviews.title: Only see one flaw
customer_reviews.text: Great cone overall and dog doesn't mind it too much. We got it in a size just past her snout by an inch only so her peripheral isn't too obfuscated. She can't reach her paws anymore for licking due to seasonal allergies. She's gotten better since, so I do recommend this cone. There is only one flaw, and that's the biga** company logo on the side. It was cute to see at first but now it's a constant eyesore. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Filántropo Azteca

customer_reviews.title: huge improvement over the one Vet provided
customer_reviews.text: This was a well worth it purchase so much more comfortable for my dog, and did the job plus it has just enough give to make is a little easier for your dog to get around without losing his mind. My one complain is that the loops that your dogs collar is supposed to go through are to small and only made for a fairly skinny collar. I used it with gauze going through the loops and then just with the Velcro it worked fine. So took of one start for that fact about the loops
customer_reviews.author: Opethiandream2112

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality & Easy
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome. Much better than the thin plastic one that the vet gave to us and so much quieter. This is very high quality and was so easy to put on and off. It does not have to attach to the collar making it more stable around the head. This was so comfy for my dog... hence the name Comfy Cone. It has adjustment strips on it so you can adjust for the size you need... and its easy to do. I just loved this product and so did my dog!!
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Cone of shame works
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves this cone and has adapted to it. The velcro straps were strong enough to with stand his attempts at taking off the cone and easy enough to take on and off. The cone is great to keep my puppy from licking/biting while applying medication to his fur, during bath time and prevent him from licking wounds.
customer_reviews.author: Cv

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Better than the plastic ones for sure. I wish I had gone a size up, as the one I got, based off the recommended measurements, didn't fit as well. One thing to note is that my dog absolutely hated this thing at first because he couldn't see anything. He's fine with a normal cone, but he tried to tear this off for a solid 5 minutes before giving in. He needed it for a week and a half, and it is better than the plastic ones in the long run, but takes some adjustment time for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for my furry baby
customer_reviews.text: This was the third cone that I tried and it was the best. My dog was able to sleep comfortably wearing it. He had it on for two weeks until the stitches came out. It was a god-send. He didn't seem to mind it on at all. He's a 60 pound labradoodle. I ordered a medium long and should have ordered a large long - but we made it work.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen F Young

customer_reviews.title: Saved our walls and our legs
customer_reviews.text: I have a 75 lbs German Shorthair who managed to crack the cone given to us by the vet in under a day. She would run through the kitchen and knock over chairs with her original cone and even put holes in our wall with it. She would bump into us with the hard plastic and leave bruises on our legs. The comfy cone SAVED THE DAY. She still is clumsy and bumps into our walls and our legs but it doesn’t leave dents and scratches and it no longer hurts and bruises us. And it prevents her from licking her wound on her rear leg. It is functional and helps protect our walls, our legs, and our sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: I have one for each of our four dogs - very humane way to prevent them from...
customer_reviews.text: One dog at 22 pounds and 2 dogs at 35 pounds use the medium collar. One chews her back during certain times of the year due to allergies. The other dogs have had to use their collar after surgeries or treatment for something (and when they were neutered/spayed). It is good to have a humane collar handy when/if needed for your dogs and these are the best I have found. EASY to put on with velcro closing and doesn't stress the dog out to wear it. They are sturdy and very good quality - built to last. Just remember where you stored it so you have it when needed.
customer_reviews.author: bascelflt

customer_reviews.title: An OK Cone
customer_reviews.text: Bought it & used it for a few days following our dog's eye surgery. Our Lhasa didn't like it. Got a clear, plastic cone. Dog liked it, could see better, fit better, was easy to clean, sturdier and didn't flop around as did this one. So, it's OK but, for our dog, if a cone is needed again, we'll use the clear plastic one as we have given away this cone to charity as it was in "new" condition and may work for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Nice cone but no better than what the doctor gave us. We didn't use it.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog preferred the plastic transparent cone provided by the doctor. We are tempted to spend money to make our pets as comfortable as possible and of course vendors gladly enable us to do this. I recommend taking a few days to see if your dog can get used to the cone provided by the doctor. Our dog had knee surgery and needed to wear a cone for 2 weeks. After a few days he got used to the plastic cone and we could see him look -through- the plastic. That is impossible with this cone. Of course your mileage may vary :)
customer_reviews.author: Sander Pool

product_meta.title: The Original Comfy Cone, Soft Pet Recovery Collar with Removable Stays
product_meta.description:
Size:Large 25 cm| Color:BlackThe Comfy Cone is a soft, cone-shaped e-collar that helps your pets heal and recover from surgeries, procedures, allergy flare-ups and hot spots in comfort. 

All Comfy Cones are made with foam-backed, padded nylon that is easy to clean and is water-resistant and repellent. The tight gauge of the nylon even prevents cats from getting their claws into the material! The Comfy Cone uses Velcro for tight closures, making it easy to get the cone on and off animals quickly. And the cone can be reversed inside and out, as well as front to back to support shoulder and upper back injuries. 

The Comfy Cone comes with three sizing strips that let you adjust the size of the cone for a secure fit. Use the Sizing Chart and Measuring Guide above or on our website to determine the right size for your pet.

Along with the sizing strips, each cone comes with removable plastic stays that let you determine how structured the cone should be for your pet. Remove the stays for a more flexible cone and keep them in for firmer structure, like when a pet has had eye surgery. Once the stays are removed, the Comfy Cone can even be folded back for added freedom while eating and drinking or when checking wounds and irritations. All Comfy Conehave a reflective edge for safety and elastic loops at the neck to thread your pet’s collar through. 

It’s perfect to use during recovery as well as during playtime at home or at the park!

DISCLAIMER: The Comfy Cone is an alternative to a plastic cone and as with any medical devices, please supervise your pet when they are wearing it. It’s best to purchase an authentic, new Comfy Cone for your pet. All Four Paws cannot approve of the condition or function of any Comfy Cone not purchased new and directly through an authorized retailer. Neck to Snout Measurements: 4.25 inches , Neck Size: 9.75-12.5 inches

Removable plastic stays to add structure when needed
Water resistant/repellent & easy to wipe clean with soap and water
